sentence.text: A gendarme ran in white-faced and clutched Fouchard by the arm , shouting , ` The ghost , Monsieur l ` Inspecteur . "
` Funny joke , " said Garvey , clutching his angel by the shirt .
She sprang up , knocking over her coffee-cup in the process , and clutched Robyn by the shoulders .
David Swan fell backwards over a chair , clutching his knee in agony .
She clutched the soft sponge in her palm , feathery with water and soap .
She was clutching something in her right hand , something covered in white powder , as she weaved towards us and sat down heavily and out of breath .
The Welsh international clutched his head in his hands fearing the worst -- and it happened .
I leant against the mulberry tree clutching Radish in my fist and had a bit of a cry there .
She held out her right hand awkwardly , still clutching the briefcase in the other .
The Â£5.5 million star endured a heart-stopping few minutes against Genoa , crashing to the ground after a tackle and clutching the same knee in which he ruptured ligaments 16 months ago .
A small , terrified child clutching a satchel with both arms as though it were her most prized possession .
Closing her eyes briefly , she bent her head , clutching the basin with both hands .
He gave a feeble chuckle , and clutched his ribs with his left hand .
Then Emmie helped him out of the skip and along the railway ; he clutched her with one hand and held Murgatroyd with the other .
The artists were left in the courtyard , where they stood clutching their equipment with the anxious , uncertain air of a group of refugees .
She clutched Madeleine around the waist .
Finally , she stumbled , fell against a wall , clutching it for support and sobbing .
His sister clutched his arm .
About fifty of us filed in , clutching our drinks .
The Frenchman , in bare feet and clutching his overalls , hurried southwards .
He let the mattress sag to one side and clutched his scalp , swaying dizzily for a moment .
After a moment , he took a cigar from his pocket , lit it with his gold Cartier lighter , and shifted it until it was clutched between his teeth .
Cedar harpoons were clutched in their hands , anchored to the floats by long coils of rope made from cedar bark .
And suddenly she felt as stiff and cold and fragile as the champagne glass that was clutched in her shaking hand .
Shelley 's hands were clutched tightly round the mug of coffee , and Rosie wisely let her talk it out of her system .
They clutched each other and fell about , it made them laugh so much .
Firmly clutching her hand he slowed , and Frere arced around them on still skates so that he made a sweeping circle on the ice before they came , breathless , to a halt .

Clutching her battered handbag , graceless in her servant 's clothes , Sally-Anne Tunstall advanced into the ambassador 's private drawing-room to confront her mother and father , who stared at the strange sight she presented .
When they broke for coffee Gesner went over to her , clutching his paper cup in his hand .
Gina clutched the receiver more tightly .
She clutched Susan 's arm for a moment .
I clutch at his arm , and he holds me , and does not let me go when I am upright .
Ruth lowered her eyes and clutched at the banister of the stairs .
A sob burst from her throat , and she clutched at him fiercely , dragged his head down to hers .
He clutched onto Gillian 's hand with alarming gratitude , as if previously girls had always insisted on his wearing oven-gloves .
He himself ate nothing but stood beaming in the middle of the room , his whisky glass clutched in his hand .
Shiona swallowed drily , her fingers clutched tightly around her glass as she continued to stare with unblinking , blurred vision at the photograph of Ryan in the big silver frame .
Willie clutched on to the long wooden seat and , as they jolted over the rough cobbled road , his eyelids drooped and he became drowsy .
